message.content:
cs.CV, cs.BIO, cs.LG, cs.MED, cs.IR 

The paper deals with the development of a deep learning-based system for estimating tissue oxygen saturation from RGB images and sparse hyperspectral signals. This involves the use of computer vision techniques (cs.CV) for processing the RGB images and the development of a conditional generative adversarial network (GAN) for fusing features from both RGB and hyperspectral signals. The application of the system is in the medical field, specifically in the detection of ischaemia and monitoring perfusion, which falls under the categories of bioinformatics (cs.BIO) and medical imaging (cs.MED). The use of a GAN for feature fusion and estimation of tissue oxygen saturation also involves machine learning techniques (cs.LG). Finally, the paper also discusses the optimization of the hardware based on simulation results, which falls under the category of information retrieval (cs.IR).
